name: GAP65 material mat testing - PSD(Grading), Sand Equivalent >=25; and Plasticity Index<8 (IANZ Test Reports required)
○ Note 1: Test frequency as per ITP
○ Aggregate material compliance for Subbase stockpiles – CPS Hold Point
Comments: Material Test Report – Comply with TNZ M/3 Specification. NZTA B/2 Specification Lab Test for MDD at OWC
Subgrade final trim inspected, and a proof roll witnessed by CPS/Designer – CPS Hold Point
Subbase Compaction - NDM tested (Mean>=95% of MDD; Minimum>= 92% of MDD) – IANZ Test Report required – CPS Hold Point
○ Note 1: To test every 30m of road per lane, staggered at 15m
Saw cutting – proposed Saw cut line to be inspected by the Engineer – CPS Hold Point
Comments: Visual inspection – Project specification 6.6. Photos provided
Surface shape check prior to Basecourse construction - stringing line checked and no point of the surface shall vary more than 10mm over a 3m long straight edge – CPS Hold Point
○ Note 1: To check every 10m both parallel and perpendicular to centreline
Comments: Measurement Stringing line Record Sheet
Subbase as-builts: Width, Levels and Crossfall within tolerances:
(a) Width: Unconstrained: –20 mm +100 mm; Constrained: Zero
(c) Crossfall: no depart from the design crossfall by more than 0.5%
Final Inspection - a proof roll witnessed by CPS/Design prior to basecourse (Deflection no greater than 10mm, and no visual cracking or deformation remaining after pass) – CPS Hold Point
The above works have been inspected and are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions
Material production testing (1/source and at least 1/3 months):
○ Aggregate material compliance for Basecourse stockpiles – CPS Hold Point
Comments: Material Test Report – Aggregate shall comply with TNZM/4
Visual inspection for any defects on the subbase – CPS Hold Point
Basecourse Compaction: - NDM tested (Mean>=98% of MDD; Minimum>= 95% of MDD) – CPS Hold Point
○ Note 1: To test every 30m of road per lane, staggered at 15m
Basecourse Benkelman Beam Test (only when specified on IFC drawings):
○ No more than 5% of the deflections exceed 1.4; No single deflection exceeds 1.5mm -- check moisture content if high deflections are obtained.
○ Note 1: At 10m interval in each traffic lane- staggered
Comments: Benkelman Beam Deflection Test Record – only if required
Basecourse FWD: Testing to only be performed post Benkelman Beam deflection testing based on results.  Not required for chip seal roads – CPS Hold Point
○ Note 1: At 20m staggered intervals in each traffic lane
Basecourse surface shape - stringing line checked and within tolerances:
(a) Level: with concrete channel and at or close to the lip of channel –5 mm +5 mm; other locations -5mm +15mm (Survey Report attached);
(b) Crossfall: no depart from the design crossfall by more than 0.5%;
(c) Manhole lids must be in line with the crossfall.
○ Note 1: 1/10m intervals and across manhole lids – CPS Hold Point
Comments: Survey Record Sheet & Stringing record sheet – no point of the surface shall vary more than 10mm over a 3m long straight edge
Final Inspection - Prior to chip sealing or asphalt surfacing – CPS Hold Point
Comments: Visual Inspection – the large and small aggregates are held in place and the matrix does not displace under normal trafficking or sweeping
The above works have been inspected and are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions
